intro: Lagascea rigida var. mocinniana, commonly known as the rigid lagascea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces blue or violet-colored blooms, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
